alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 09 at 4:30PM CDT until August 09 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ANDERSON AND NORTHWESTERN KNOX COUNTIES... At 530 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oak Ridge, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Farragut, Bearden, Powell and Karns. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 374 and 387. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 117. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
